block.p: Elizabeth Whitney Denny, the daughter of Cassandra Hopkins Watson of Wilson, Wyo., and R. Breck Denny of New York, was married yesterday to Daniel Sterling Oneglia, a son of Catherine S. Oneglia and Gregory S. Oneglia of Litchfield, Conn. The Right Rev. J. Clark Grew II, who retired as the Episcopal bishop of Ohio, officiated at St. Andrew's Episcopal Church in Boca Grande, Fla., with the Rev. C. Read Heydt, also an Episcopal priest, taking part.

Mrs. Oneglia, 30, is a preschool teacher at the Episcopal School in New York. She graduated from Kenyon College and received a master's degree in early childhood and elementary education from Bank Street College of Education. Her father is a business consultant in New York.

Elizabeth Whitney Denny, the daughter of Cassandra Hopkins Watson of Wilson, Wyo., and R. Breck Denny of New York, was married yesterday to Daniel Sterling Oneglia, a son of Catherine S. Oneglia and Gregory S. Oneglia of Litchfield, Conn. The Right Rev. J. Clark Grew II, who retired as the Episcopal bishop of Ohio, officiated at St. Andrewâ€™s Episcopal Church in Boca Grande, Fla., with the Rev. C. Read Heydt, also an Episcopal priest, taking part.

Elizabeth Whitney Denny, the daughter of Cassandra Hopkins Watson of Wilson, Wyo., and R. Breck Denny of New York, was married yesterday to Daniel Sterling Oneglia, a son of Catherine S. Oneglia and Gregory S. Oneglia of Litchfield, Conn. The Right Rev. J. Clark Grew II, who retired as the Episcopal bishop of Ohio, officiated at St. Andrew's Episcopal Church in Boca Grande, Fla., with the Rev. C. Read Heydt, also an Episcopal priest, taking part.

Mrs. Oneglia, 30, is a preschool teacher at the Episcopal School in New York. She graduated from Kenyon College and received a master's degree in early childhood and elementary education from Bank Street College of Education. Her father is a business consultant in New York.

Mr. Oneglia, 30, is a vice president for bonds, currencies and commodities trading at Goldman Sachs, the New York investment bank. He graduated from Princeton. His father is the vice chairman of O&G Industries, a construction company in Torrington, Conn.
